intro: Epilobium sandorii, commonly known as Sandor's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
